decision.raw:
<contrarian_case>
The Patriots are undervalued at 37.6% implied probability, as the market has overshot on Seahawks hype due to AI anchoring on Seattle's regular-season dominance (No. 1 FPI offense/defense) and Darnold's NFC Championship outlier performance, ignoring deeper nuances. Bull case for New England: (1) Elite passing offense (1st in EPA/dropback, 2nd Pass DVOA, 3rd overall DVOA) perfectly counters Seahawks' defense, which allowed 12 explosives to the Rams and faces a healthy Drake Maye (shoulder fully cleared, full practice participant) who can exploit Seattle's red-zone vulnerabilities. (2) Patriots playoff defense has been lights-out (just 6 explosives allowed in 3 games vs. injured offenses), primed to force mistakes from an injury-nagged Darnold (oblique) who's been middling for two months outside one fluke game. (3) Sharp money on Pats ML (+190/+195) despite stagnant spread, signaling value vs. public/algos piling on SEA -4.5; Vegas pros (billions at stake) see it as a coin-flip closer to 50/50 than 62/38. (4) No model correlation blind spots‚ÄîPats are 10th FPI overall, 11th defense, with depth in key matchups (e.g., Pats OL doesn't need perfection vs. SEA pass rush). Crowd wrong on overconfidence in SEA narrative; Pats reached SB for a reason, and conservative schemes (7-man coverage, force runs) win low-scoring grinder.
</contrarian_case>
